description: This place is an awesome throwback, from the poster of Drago to sci fi lighting, it's all good
author: Ali S.

description:
Worst bar ive ever been to, bouncer on Friday evening was incredibly rude and needs to be fired. Between the terrible service (20 mins to even be talked to) and the overall lack of empathy for anything resembling a customer, human beings dont deserve to be treated as poorly as the bouncer treated us. If he has a job after all of what
 he tried to get away with, soda popinski cannot be in business anymore. the bar must be put out of the business and anyone who has worked for them must not work for them again. One of the worst experiences i've ever been part of. Could not think of a worse establishment to give money to, clearly anyone who hires bouncers like that were working Friday evening should not be given our hard earned money. Worst experience ive ever had, i dont need to pay money to be disrespected. Fuck the guys working there Friday evening. Worst bar in San Francisco by a country and liberal
mile DO NOT GO.
author: Ani R.

description:
I love the name. My first kinda bar feel in SF and I just love how unique it is! My friends and I came pretty late as we came from a club and the place was ready to close. The decorates were pretty cool and there's even video games here and a fun wheel with drinks! 

My friend got a shot from the fun wheel and it was super sweet though. Although my visit was quick, I can see this dive bar as a great place for a quick stop on a night of bar hopping!
author: Jenny H.

description:
Are you a frat bro?  Come join us!!  Maybe a hipster who can only shout "brooo!!  Super Smash Bros is my JAM, bro!!"?  This one's for you!!  Or maybe a shot wheel is a solid 30 minute convo piece on a good date for you?  Bring her!!

So this place is not my pace, but it's certainly got a vibe (and a loud one).  Video game consoles are a nice touch and it's not hard to jump on one for a while.  Beyond that, you've gotta love loud, crowded and hammered to make it past 10pm.

Man, if they were open for lunch, I'd hide out here for a few hours at a go!  But alas, again, I don't think I'm their target scene...ahh, 30s.
author: Nathan B.

description:
Soda Pops is a super fun bar and a great place to go with a group of people. They have a "fun wheel" that is $12 a spin and you can win an assortment of things such as: a bottle of champs, two girl scout shots, a shot and beer, etc. All of the prizes are, of course, alcohol related because you are at a bar. It is great fun to watch people spin the wheel and see what they get. 

It can get super crowded on the weekends so it might be hard to get in especially if you try to go after 9pm on a Friday or Saturday. They have fresh squeezed grapefruit juice so that is a definite plus since they don't carry Deep Eddy. The bartenders were all really nice too despite the chaos that was happening at and around the bar.
author: Stephanie A.

description:
This place is my jam. Maybe it's the video games that are attached to TVs in the back. Maybe it's the fact that there is a wheel to spin where you can "win" different drinks. Just kidding, it's definitely the wheel.

I've come here multiple times throughout the past couple of years. Usually pretty busy during the weekend, and not too packed if you come during the week. Not a lot of seating which fits the vibe, but can definitely feel cramped when it is super busy.

The wheel changes the prizes that are available every so often. I've won things from pickle backs to a boot of Moscow Mule (Mule Kick) to actually getting the bottle of champagne (the dream!). Last time I won 4 shots of bartender's choice. Pro-tip: Tip the bartender well to get better shots.
author: Rajeev S.

description:
The best 10 minutes I could have at a bar! 

My friend and I had a little time to kill before we got to our escape room reservations. This was his favorite bar and it was close by to our reservations so we thought "hey, let's just go in for one spin on the wheel". It was my first time here and my friend bought me my first spin. I landed on a fireball and another free spin. I let my friend take on the next free spin we had. It landed on fireball and free spin again!! We tried a third time and we hit fireball and free spin!!! For the 4th spin, we got 2 shots of crown vanilla. So within 10 min, we got 5 shots at $11. 

The excitement was real.
author: Teri C.

description: Drown out the block with their music when they leave their front opened up.  Piss poor neighbors.
author: Click C.

description:
I thought they had more games than the spinning wheel on the wall, but maybe not?

Went here on a Friday rowdy and noisy night (or maybe I'm just getting old for the ruckus?).  I couldn't hear myself nor was it bearable to hear people talking.  Hopped out and went next door, Italian restaurant, for wine or beer. 

Good for Santacon and grabbing drinks.  Then, onto the next!
author: Tiffany D.

description: Any bar named after a character in Mike Tyson' s Punch Out has to be awesome, right? Too bad they didn't go with the original Drunkenski. Anyways this place rules. It's kitschy but the drinks don't suck. I highly suggest a salty dog. Can get a lil crowded as the night goes on and the douchery from Polk wanders up, but the bartenders are pretty fast so just keep drinking vodka shots. Oh yeah and the Monday night Mario Cart gaming streamed on Twitch is awesome too. Fun like the Foundry, but more intimate. They also have trivia night's. Cold War kids getting drunk and doing the Fancy Bear ;)
author: Sabrina D.

description: We did a fundraiser event here on a Friday by being a guest bartender from 6pm to 9pm. I had no previous experience but the real bartender gave us a 30-minute crush course before the event. It was so much fun and thank you for letting us do a fundraiser event here! Every one of us said we would do it again!
author: Alice L.

description:
My friends were raving about this bar for Trivia Tuesday so a group of my coworkers and I decided to come after work... and it was SO MUCH FUN. There's a wheel in there when you spin for a random drink/todo... there are games and large tables. 

Our group ended up winning 2nd overall and got a round of shots (amazing!)
author: Carrie L.

description:
Soda is a great neighborhood institution. A no-frills bar that skews a tad bit on the divey side with:

1) Wide selection of spirits and beers at reasonable prices
2) Fun spin-the-wheel game for a random drink
3) 90s video games, and sometimes sports and good movies playing
4) Good music and strong party vibe on the weekends
5) Ridiculous Mon-Fri happy hour where EVERYTHING is 2-for-1
6) Sun-Mon 10pm-close where it's 2-for-1 on all liquor
author: Gore S.

description: Horrible bar, with rude bar tenders! We came here on a Sunday to celebrate a graduation and the bartender gave us the most attitude, didn't want/let us spin the wheel gave us attitude when we did. Still trying to contact the manager but no answers. Spend your money somewhere else.
author: Emily T.

description: Old school arcade games, $12 spin wheel. This bar is a lot of fun but can get pretty crowdy and rowdy as the night goes on. Recommended as a fun bar hopping stop!
author: Christina N.

description: Affordable drinks, dive atmosphere, cool spin the wheel concept. The crowd was 21-23ish looking for cheap booz.
author: Ben C.

description: So I have been to this bar a good number of times and each time I have had a good time even telling other they should come out to the bar. On September 8th I went to the bar to hanging out; I sat next to two women I ordered two beers and would chit chat with both. The bartender said I was cut off, I asked why he said I was bothering both women. I told the bartender to ask both women if I was they both said I was fine. I then asked the bartender if I was still cut off he told me yes with a smirk on his face. This is the first time, I had a ugly experience at this bar and that bartender was a true ass. I would get it if I was sloppy drunk and bothering the women if that were really the case I would have expected the door man to escort me out. The two women even felt bad and wanted to buy me a drink they thought the bartender might of had an issue with me because I am Latino. I am not saying the bartender is a bigot but he had a focused eye on me for sure. I hope if I do think about going to this bar again I hope not to see that bartender again because I will definitely leave.
author: Dennis S.

description: This place is so fun! Fake dive with a USSR theme. Spin the wheel. It will probably be gross (the odds are against you), but you'll like that part too. Great staff and great crowd.
author: Kensey W.

description:
Love spinning the wheel here because you never know what you can land on.
I have yet to win the bottle of champagne. 

The worst thing you can get here is the cement mixer. There's some kind of dairy and pickle or lemon juice in there so if you don't drink it fast enough, it'll curdle. Disgusting! If you get caught cheating on the wheel, that's your default drink so don't think you're being sneaky!
author: Kelly L.

description:
Hot destination for ratchet millennials - period. 

It was super fun and wild here. You know when you've entered a ratchet distinction when you step into a bar and your shoes sticks to the floor with every step - immediately you know what you're in for - yikes. 

They have a cool game wheel where you can win prizes (aka alcohol). To play, you pay $11 and spin. You can win a mix drink, 10 shots, a grand prize of a champagne bottle, etc. No one's a loser - you'd win something every time. 

I'd come back regardless of the sticky floor. Just beware that it gets really crowded here.
author: Becca S.

description:
This bar is a bit "divey", but the bartenders make an effort to create a fun environment with good music.

There are also great drink choices that is suiting for girls and guys. There is a small but interesting draft beer selection! 

Soda Popinski's has 90's video games! The bar is very busy on the weekends. Their Mon-Fri happy hour is probably the best deal in the city! EVERYTHING IS 2 FOR 1!
author: Nancy F.

description:
Used to be a cool spot but now has tech bro date-rapey vibes. Music was good, old school and new school rap, but the people that were at the bar didn't know music so would go crazy when a white poppy song would come on. Bartender with the tatted sleeves ignored us and eventually got
Our order, but forgot so we waited like 20 mins for our drinks while she got her flirt on w some really loud frat bros before we eventually left.
3 stars only because the  white ppl who do go to the bar don't know good music/how to dance so they would sit out during good songs leaving lots of room for us to dance, and also the Latino bartender who was chill and attentive. Used to be a cool spot, a bummer now, but the business can't control the kind of people that show up. I will say that people are repeatedly commenting on the rude service. I understand that as a bartender you have to accommodate a lot of customers, and the occasional flirting is sometimes part of the job. But don't leave customers for 20 minutes waiting for their drinks. We even made eye contact a few times. Obviously humoring the frat bros was more important than serving people who are very polite and leave generous tips.
author: Josh C.

description:
If you come here, you have to SPIN THE WHEEL! $11 for The Wheel of Adventure.. or Nightmare, depends on the outcome. My friends and I came here after sake bombs at Yamasho. We all spin it and got a bottle of CHAMPAGNE, boot-sized moscow mule, 4 shots of bartender choice (don't know what it was, but it was sweet and smooth!), hand grenade (whiskey and jager bomb), and 2 rounds of 2 pickle backs. We passed everything around in a circle and we finished it all alive. 

Our journey continued down Polk Street... Cheers to good times!
author: Hoyan L.

description: I read other reviews prior to coming here for a bday party and saw some people were complaining about the bartenders service. I didn't think too much of it and when I first arrived, the female bartender who served me was just fine. I ordered a water and she gave me ice water from the bar. I came back later and ordered an old fashioned and while it was wayyyy too watered down, she was still fine. Later that night I had my boyfriend get me another water. When he did, the male bartender directed him to the self serve water with small ass plastic cups and warm water. Why did my boyfriend get redirected to that when they served me ice water, no questions asked? To put a cherry on top of it, that same exact bartender saw my boyfriend watching the basketball game on one of the TVs...made eye contact with him and proceeded to turn off the tv. Mind you, there's two TVs at the bar, one was playing the game and the other was playing Troy. WTF? Did he really turn off that specific tv just to be a dick? If he did, it was completely uncalled for. So overall I'll give one star for the cool video games and another for the decent music. Other than that, I was disappointed.
author: Kari C.

description: This bar was super fun! They have good music for dancing, the spin wheel where you make friends who cheer you on, and even some video games! Spinning the wheel was worth it because it's about as much as you would pay for a drink anyways but you're doing it in a fun way. People are watching to see what you get and even cheer for the wheel to give you something good. We ended up dancing with the people who were cheering me on, it was a lot of fun. My bf even got to play video games while I waited in the line for the ladies room!
author: Nayeli F.

description:
Would be a pretty standard Polk Gulch bar, but the drinking wheel makes it a standout. I'm fully aware that the wheel is way gimmicky - it's still fun.

For $11 you get to spin a wheel that yields everything from picklebacks to a full bottle of champagne. There are some gross/bad options (e.g. tabasco/tequila shots), but that's all part of the wheel's allure.  Not to brag, but I've won the champagne bottle twice. 

The bar is named after one of the bosses in Punch Out on NES and there is a vague video game-themed ambiance. To that end, there's a couple of Nintendo consoles set up in the back if you're feeling nostalgic. 

The wheel alone has landed Soda Popinski's on the low-brow Nob Hill bar tour that I give to SF visitors -   right after the Tonga Room, right before a bacon-wrapped street dog on Polk. 

The bar is usually pretty packed on weekends, so I try to get in, spin, and get out as soon as possible.
author: Ryan D.

description: We had a great event here for my dental school! I will have to check the place out on a normal weekend to see how it is. But for an event, it was a fundraising bartending event it was the perfect venue.
author: Nikita K.

description:
I go to a bar to get shitty (half kidding..) not to have someone make customers feel shitty. Every time I go here, it is always a hit or miss--which is sad because I really like the wheel and what they have to offer. 

The past two times after spinning the wheel, the bartender has been a sassy douche bag. I say this because my friend span the wheel for her birthday and she got a bottle of champagne and the bartender (who was not even looking) claimed that she didn't spin that herself and poured her a shot of vodka with lots of tabasco sauce in it. After she drank this, she almost threw up from all that tabasco! 

And to add salt to injury, we came back the second time and saw that people were moving the wheel in front of the bartender and he was honoring these new wheel spins. And when my group span it again, we got the Mule Kick and he claimed that we should tip higher since its a pricier drink. I get that we must tip, but NO NEED to force people to do shit. After we tipped only 3 dollars, he was rude to us the whole night. 

I don't mean to make a BAD review from a few sad encounters. I have been here for the 2 for 1 deals and I really enjoy the music here, but I will avoid this place as long as this douche bag bartender works here.  Don't know if this is the only bar tender they have, but this tall half white half asian bartender is the WORST and would avoid him at all cost. It really devalues this place....
author: Eric Joseph D.

description:
Fun fact: Soda Popinski's is named after a Soviet Russian boxer in the nes game Punch-Out! However, in the original arcade version of the game, he was supposed to be named Vodka Drunkinski (it was the Cold War), but Nintendo of America decided to change it around the same time Mike Tyson endorsed the home version.

So this bar could've been called Vodka Drunkinski's, but times have changed. But still, inside the bar, is a slice of 80s Americana. 

There are plenty of TV sets, set up with video game consoles, old and new, with mostly sports games, but there a handful of old gems like Bad Dudes. Perfect game for this bar.

There's a wheel, and for 11 bucks you get to spin the wheel, and the bartenders give you whatever shot you land on. Some are amazing, and you wished you remembered what was in them. (There's one section called 3-1-5, and there's a picture of Sean Connery from the Hunt for Red October. I don't remember this movie besides how funny it is to hear one of the most famous Scottish actors ever playing a Russian submarine captain. What is this cocktail?), and some are a lot of bomber drinks, like a rum and tequila bomb in Sprite. One option is a bottle of champagne. Or, you can "So a shot of turkey for freedom, and spin again for AMERICA!"

The music is classic American songs, but way over the top. They'll play 80s Christmas carols, and the bartenders will throw napkins in the air so you can pretend it's snowing. 

The only downsides are that the lines are a little long for the wheel, and sometimes you have to blow into the cartridges for the game systems. Definitely a bar to visit in San Francisco, especially if you're a fan of retro games, or want to relive the glory days of a decade that you probably weren't alive for. 

My only suggestion would be to have game tournaments on a few nights a month, but drinking versions. Beerio Kart would be so much fun!
author: Mike P.

description:
How often can you go into a bar and say their worst drink is still their best drink? Though the bar's iconic spin-the-wheel may seem hokey, it is sure to start or contribute to a fun night. 
While the wheel might have sentenced me to a cup of doom, their signature cocktails such as  the Mule Kick are skillfully crafted. Soda Popinski's offers a unique environment that offers an alternative to the status quo bar, especially switching billiards for old school video games.
author: Sandra K.

description:
Pretty chill bar! My friends and I went around 5pm on a Friday and it wasn't crowded at all. 

First off, DON'T SPIN THE WHEEL UNTIL HAPPY HOUR IS OVER! We got really excited and each spun the wheel, which ended up being 44+tax. Later, a guy walked past us and told us that we should've spun the wheel after happy hour was over... We still had a lot of fun spinning and got the "Mind Eraser", "Cement Mixer" (disgusting!), "Irish Car Bomb" (me), and a bottle of champagne! Afterwards, we ordered a couple rounds of shots and beers, which ended up being a good deal because of the happy hour.
author: Soorin P.

description: Great bar! It was pretty packed on the Thursday night that my friend and I went to get drinks. The bartenders were very attentive and the chains were very tasty yet strong. Video games in the back where a lot of fun especially as we kept drinking. Also, the spin wheel of drinks is a must! I got a double tequila shit for $12. Can't complain
author: Amanda B.

description: Small, delightful, and retro. Highly recommend the $11 spin a wheel, you might win a bottle of champagne or typically get two shots. Also, try the Mule Kick Either way it's fun. Kyle who bartends on Sunday night is insanely fun.
author: Kishore N.

description:
Pretty cool spot

Got a good happy hour deal of buy one get one

Love the classic NES

Good vibes all around with a very diverse crowd
author: Kris N.

description:
TL;DR - I love this place. I wish I could live here. Jk, then I'd be an alcoholic.
 
My friend and I wanted to find a place chill and a low-key. Soda Popinski's was it. This place is crowded, plays old school (90's) hiphop, and the drinks are cheap but strong. Best place to get wasted and catch up haha.

The wheel is super fun, definitely worth a go at least once :]
author: Crystal Z.

description: Came here on a Saturday night with a group of friends and I actually had a lot of fun. They have a jukebox, which always makes everything more fun. The drinks are reasonably priced, and the place is conveniently located just off of Polk street. I really liked the spinner that they had. One of my friends won a bottle of champagne on his spin, another won a boot of a slushy drink on his spin. All and all we had a great night, a bar that I have never checked out, but will definitely be going back to. It's a quieter place, unless you bring your own rowdy group to make it a little more crazy!
author: Ross S.

description:
Came by with a large group of friends as the first stop of our bar-hopping night (although some of us didn't make it to the second stop LOL) and it was so fun! We took turns spinning the wheel (around $15 after tip and tax) which is such a great deal! Everything we spun was either super huge or multiple shots so great for getting buzzed on a budget. Some spins we got: the huge Moscow Mule boot, the bear fight (2-3 shots), and the best prize of all -- a bottle of champagne!!! We couldn't even finish all our drinks before heading to the next bar just from a few spins!

Highly recommend if looking for a bar near Polk street :)
author: Jingxi Z.

description:
It was exciting spinning the wheel. I don't know why but I kept wanting to get another drink so I could spin! $11 per spin, no changes and no complaints. Just drink what you get!

Was lucky and spun on the Irish car bomb - compared to my friend who got something spicy with Tabasco and lime juice.... haha 

Test your luck! Come in for a fun time. Music was good, mostly 90s to 00s hip hop and r&b. Don't come here for a deep conversation. It's way too loud for that! Friendly staff and room to breathe on a weeknight.
author: Carissa G.

description:
Soda Popinski's always guarantees a good time. It's decorated like a 1920's(?) soviet union kind of a feel. There is an old pacman game in the back ma nintendo 64, and some other game console for you to play mario kart!

Tuesdays at 8pm there is trivia night! The winner gets a bunch of drinks and the questions range from science to celeb facts. Come early to grab some seats!

Everyday, there is the giant wheel of doom (or fun). You pay $11 to spin it and you can win a variety of drinks that changes everyday. But each thing you win will be at least two shots worth, so it guarantees that you'll get $11 worth of alcohol. One of the options is a whole bottle of champagne, and I have never seen anyone get it but it is always fun to see your friends get some crazy drinks and either be dismayed or learn to love picklebacks.
author: Grace P.

description:
If you like chance, the wheel may be just what you're looking for. Came by after dinner for a girlfriend's birthday back in July 2013.

The wheel was $10 per spin (spins are now $11 each): http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/soda-popinskis-san-francisco#PJpZZ_tdGIv9TJ-sKFr84A

We each bought the birthday girl a spin and landed on:
*Pickle back http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/soda-popinskis-san-francisco#LGDiY0GqwwxyiXTOKoDdKw
*Bottle of champagne http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/soda-popinskis-san-francisco#QK6Nto5IVQ0Ffiw-UnYEgg

I'm sure a lot of the prizes are worth less than $10. But it's so much fun leaving it to chance, I didn't really care. It was fun cheering her on while we tried landing on our alcohol of choice.

They also have a Nintendo system in the back. I didn't get the chance to play with it, but I will be back. Next time!
author: Elena N.

description: Bartender was rude didn't provide service when asked for a drink on a slow night. It was seven of us. We were buying drinks. My friend decided not to tip the bartender for the bad service. She laid all the receipts on the counter demanding a tip. She kicked him out of the bar for not leaving a tip. He payed his tab. There was no reason for her to kick him out of the bar. If you don't provide good service you don't deserve a tip
author: Jorge S.

description:
I love this bar!! A MUST go when you're bar hopping close by! We make it a point to stop by here each time because it's so fun!

One of the things I like most is the wheel! Most of the time we get lucky, but it's always fun finding out what you're luck is for the night! It's 11$ a spin, so a GREAT deal for a good shot (4 shots of bartenders choice, or bear fight [split among 3 so it's not really a bear fight hehe]), etc.) or a shitty deal (like an 11$ pbr lawl); either way it's fun doing it win friends and seeing what everyone gets!!

Regardless, I always have a fun time coming here with friends! If you're here Thursday, Friday, or Saturday, James the bartender is SO much fun!! He is the best! He took shots with us, made us yummy drinks when we spun shots of bartender's choice, sang with us, and was so much fun!!! Summer and Tyler were also great too! 

Overall, yummy drinks, amazing bartenders, and fun time with friends or just if you're feeling thirsty on a Thursday, Friday, Saturday night :) Def stop by!
author: Tiffany J.

description:
The concept of this bar is great.  Who does not like a video game area in a bar?! The spin the wheel is such a wonderful idea too.  However, I hyped this place up too much before coming, and my expectations were not in the least bit met.  The layout of this place is just awful.  There is one narrow walkway with hordes of people blocking the only access way to the restrooms.  This has to be a fire hazard.  

The video game area is beyond tiny.  I was expecting multiple consoles, played in different rooms.  I did not foresee a single television with one guy playing by himself for an hour.  That was the first disappointment.  

The second let down was the wheel where you spin to see which drink you will be getting for the price of $11.  If you get the PBR, you would probably feel the most ripped off.  $11 for a can of beer is just outrageous.  

If you like small bars and large crowds, this place is for you.
author: Victor L.

description:
SODA POPINSKI'S IS DA BOMB.COM.

Seriously. I love this place. It's probably one of my favorite bars on Polk. It's not directly on Polk, but still within walking distance of all the other Polk St bars. It's a casual, semi-divey bar. Pretty small space, so it gets crowded/sweaty. The best part about this bar is that they have video games in the back LOL. You can play Mario cart while sippin away! (i.e. drunk driving -- not actually drunk driving but the drinking game drunk driving involving Mario Kart LOL. Don't drink and drive otherwise kids). The music selection is fun and they play a lot of hip hop. They were playing Mean Girls on the TV screens the other night I was there. Drinks are typical of SF bars -- pricy, but what can you expect right? They have a wheel that you can spin for drinks! $11 a pop. They have some nasty drinks on there and some great ones too, but that's the name of the game ya know. LOL. I got the cement mixer once. Did not know what it was. Hesitated. Waited too long. Found out the hard way why they call it the cement mixer. LOL NEVER AGAIN. ALWAYS DRINK WHATEVER YOU SPIN ASAP, NO QUESTIONS ASKED. You can also win a bottle of champagne. The chances are slim but possible. Also a boot full of Moscow Mule. 

Overall a very chill bar and a very fun atmosphere. We always come here when we go out on Polk St. It's a bar hopping staple in my books!
author: Amy T.

description:
Soda Popinski's is a fun little bar. You've got a NES, SNES, and N64 in the back, a roulette wheel that can nab you anything from a car bomb/Jager bomb combo to a PBR, and plenty of strong drinks to go around.

The environment is a little dudebro, but it kind of adds to the charm. Seeing my friend win a fancy bottle of champagne and seeing everyone go wild was definitely the highlight of the evening.
author: Casey S.

description:
Super friendly bartenders (I'm looking at you Hannah!), cool as beans concept, awesome decor, and A+ drinks.

Definitely a new neighborhood fave in the good ole Polk st area.

Thanks!!
author: Meaghan H.

description:
Fairly interesting bar with a dive-y atmosphere.
Good variety of drinks and beers on tap, along with a roulette wheel - $11 per spin, with prizes ranging from a bottle of champagne to a can of PBR and everything in between.  

Friendly staff but it can get a little crowded, and there's a $20 credit card minimum.
author: Oliver L.

description: At this place now. All bartenders spotted me and ignored me. Assholes.  I see now why I never got a good vibe from this place so rude.
author: Sophia H.

description:
Spinning the wheel was the most exciting thing at this bar! The best deal in the house is definitely the Mule Kick. That drink has some serious alcohol in it and it's absolutely huge! The worst drink is the cement mixer. Unfortunately a few of my friends had it, and apparently the shot curdles as soon as the bartender pours it. Credit card minimum is $20, so we got around that by buying two spins at a time!

This place has a super nintendo system with a bunch of different games that you can rent as long as you give them your driver's license. This was pretty awesome and had a blast playing the old school games.
author: Edward W.

description:
SOOOODAAAAAAAA POPIIINSKIIIIIIIIII'S!!!!!! Love this Soviet-themed place! It's a must-go when we're out gallivanting on Polk Street. 

NOTE: The card minimum is $20 so bring some cash or charge your friends on Venmo! 

For $11, you can spin the ultimate wheel of awesomeness (this may or may not be the actual name of the wheel). It's clearly the best thing in the bar and it's the reason we even come here. Some of the choices include:
- bottle of champagne
- mule kick (a "boot" of Moscow Mule)
- 4 shots, bartender's choice 
- shot of fireball + free spin
- vodka drunkenski (cup of vodka)
- two pickle backs 
- AND MORE!!! 
Trust me, you want to try for the champagne or the mule kick. You can share your drink with your friends, and they will love you for it. 

The second best part of the bar is the gaming in the back. People play old Nintendo games like Mario Kart, but don't come here just for the games on weekends... Since there are so many people, it might take a while to get your turn on a controller. 

Soda P's is actually a pretty small bar, and it gets very crowded on Friday and Saturday nights. If pushing your way through drunken people is not your thing, you might want to avoid this place. The atmosphere is loud, dark, and sweaty, but everyone is also incredibly friendly. I've made friends with people in line more than a few times -- usually our bond of friendship is solidified by their empathy when I spin a "prairie fire" (shot of vodka with hot sauce) or something similar. 

Can't wait to be back again soon! Woohoo!
author: Christine L.

description:
Cool low-key bar. Great for the start of the night when its not too busy and you're warming up. I imagine it gets hella busy towards the end of the evening. The nintendo at the back is pretty sweet. I hope they use Clorox wipes on those controllers every now and then.

Love the wheel of fortune and the tall can PBRs.

The bathrooms suck, super small and they cram 2 urinals in and the toilet. Gross.
author: Peter T.

description:
Spin the wheel!!!

Ok I didn't even spin the wheel cos I was too scared but honestly I was way too drunk to be spinning anything. My friends won drinks from spinning and for some reason they kept giving them away (mainly to me)... so you see, everyone wins.

Anyway this place was dark and dim but I did remember having a great time with my buddiessss. They also were drunk so I think everybody had a great time. I remember mostly taking shots of picklebacks because I LOVE PICKLEBACKS and ... that's it. 

Oh so Yelp has been telling me to review this place and I've been putting it off and now I know why.... cos I don't remember much cos this girl was drunk. :) My bad.
author: Fran B.

description:
Wednesdays are date nights.

Meaning, the control freak in me comes out to play. I read through Eater SF, Grubstreet, SFoodie, Thrillist, Urban Daddy, and look over my Yelp bookmarks to pick a restaurant. Once I narrowed down a restaurant, I make the reservations only to change them several hours later because I found something better. I also get to pick the bar/lounge we go to beforehand for happy hour. Did I mention, he doesn't drink?

For a lush like myself, I struck the lottery on this one so I couldn't pick just any old bar to go to.

From the owners of Bullitt, Tonic, Lightening Tavern, and Dr. Teeth & the Electric Mayhem comes Soda Popinski, a neighborhood bar in sNob Hill named after a boxer from Nintendo's Punch-Out! video game. 

We first "hung out" together at Dr. Teeth last year so I thought it was a fitting choice since it was love at first shot. Ok, it was 6 shots.

As soon as we walked into Soda Popinski, a Russian meets western themed bar (http://bit.ly/11p0Fh8) with bold reds, a bear skin rug and a large flat screen TV in the back with an old school Nintendo system, I knew I would be in trouble. Throw 2Pac, Biggie Smalls, A Tribe Called Quest, and Wu-Tang Clan in the mix and I was going to be in big trouble.

While he got his game on with one hand (http://bit.ly/VsWzNR), he got his jam on with another by ghetto *fist pumping* in the air.

I did what any good gf (and lush) would do and let him do his thing while I took advantage of the 2 for 1 happy hour specials. For 90 minutes, I sipped on my Cucumber Cooler (Bombay Sapphire Gin-based) which was only $5 because of the hh special. Unlike other bars that have hh specials, the bartender does not skimp on the alkie here. The Cucumber Cooler (http://bit.ly/W84jqt) was deliciously dangerous and the proof was in the pudding... 

After One Cucumber Cooler, I was flushed and giddy.

After two Cucumber Coolers, I was trying to get my game on except I was battling the controller more than the turtles and piranha plants in Super Mario 3.

After three Cucumber Coolers, move over Soda Popinski, Miss Gin Drunkenski is in the house!

The only thing I remember was waking up to kissing the porcelain throne at 6 am the next morning.

*SIGH*

I knew I would be in BIG trouble...

OTHER NOTES:
*Awesome bartenders and service with a smile.
*Chill, mix crowd.
*90s Rap and Hip Hop music mixed in with some freestyle and Top 40s. 
*Cocktails are $10 (2 for 1 during happy hour 5 pm - 7 pm) but stiff so totally worth the price. 
*For $10, you can spin the Russian Roulette Wheel and win anything from a PBR to the $22 Mule Kick (served in das boots) to a bottle of bubbly. 
*2 flat screen TVs at the bar for game nights. 
*Take a trip down memory lane with their Nintendo system with a good selection of games: http://bit.ly/VzMnIL.
*One restroom for each sex.
*Easy metered street parking found before 6 PM. A nightmare after.
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
I'm getting older now, so I have to start thinking about Legacy.  Oh sure, I'm only in my mid-30's, but as you get older there starts to be a vague notion that one day there will be an end.  These days, I'm starting to think about my Drinking Legacy, and I fear that if the book was written on me today I'd be liable for one huge charge:  I lived 100 yards from Soda Popinski's and I only went there how many times?  Gather ye Rosebuds.  

Admittedly, I am a big fan of the folks who brought you Soda Popinski's.  You might know them from Dr. Teeth and the Electric Mayhem, Tonic, Bullitt, Jackalope, Lightening Tavern and the now defunct Royal Tug Yacht Club.  They have a magic touch when it comes to creating good spaces and good themes.  

Soda Popinski's takes it's name from a video game character.  Are you familiar with mid-80's Ninetendo?  8-bit Graphics, but games that were fun and iconic.  I was a 6 or 7 year-old when I got to play Mike Tyson's Punch-Out for the first time at a neighbor's house.  Soda Popinski was a Soviet (they were Soviet then) fighter.  Fun Fact:  He was supposed to be called Vodka Drunkinski, but someone realized that would not be good for the Cold War.  Probably wise.  ... I digress.  The name of the bar is apropos given one of the stand-out features of this bar is a ready selection of Nintendo, Super Nintendo and N64 games and a big TV and game area.  In case you're thinking this out, that means Mario, Zelda, Mario Cart, Goldeneye ... record-scratch, yep, late-90's Goldeneye where you could play with four people on one screen back before the current game systems basically allowed us to become serial killers.  (Fact)   Some of these games are additively fun.  When we were little kids, the sheer joy of the games was enough of a thrill.  Now, we get to add booze.

Nostalgia in the face of Impending Legacy.  This is also a good bar.  While it has novelty because of the games, it is not a bar that should be defined by that quality alone.  In my dozen trips or so, I've played games two or three times.  And trust me, it isn't a gamer crowd.  This is attracting the same crowds as R Bar, Wreck Room, Zeki's, Playland, McTeague's, Harper and Rye, etc.  I come for the 2-4-1 Happy Hours.  5-7pm is 2-4-1.  They have Total Domination on tap, so that works for me.  But, I'm increasingly taken by good cocktails lately, and they have a few winners which at 2-4-$11 isn't bad.  (Aside - 1-4-$11 is a 'lil steep)  I recommend the Spicy Grapefruit Margarita, particularly if it is made just right.  They have a few good things here that are worth exploring.   Oh yeah, and they have a Wheel of Drinks.

Legacy.  Once upon a time I got excited as a kid when I went over to a friends house and they had the cool new game system.  I went home excited, but not a happy camper, because I had no Nintendo.  But guess what, Bobby doesn't live a next door to Soda Popinski's in the Heart of the Funnest Neighborhood in America.  I think I won.  But, Gather ye Rosebuds, because they'll be writing our Drinking Obituaries soon enough.  This is a good bar to visit if you haven't, and a good place to return-to if you have.
author: Adam S.

description: James Clark is a great bartender! He is great with people and knows how to make you feel at home. Come to this bar.
author: Austin-Ace T.

description: If you're looking for a place full of 25 year old douche bags, this is the place! Absolutely awful. Two guys PURPOSELY flooded the men's toilet (we witnessed it) which caused the ENTIRE bar to flood full of men's piss & who knows what else. We told the bouncers exactly who did such a childish act and they did NOTHING. Those guys should have been forced to drink the liquid that my shoes are currently soaked in. Such a shame. We were excited for the $11 "spin the wheel" drink they offer (which we participated in & was cool). We brought 10 people with us and none of us will be back. ......& it wasn't just those two "toilet clogging A** holes" who were the problem- the entire bar was full of men & women who should have been on an episode of Jersey Shore. *sigh*.
author: Rob M.

description:
The environment here is laid back and fun! I love that they have old school Mario available to play! I also like the "Russian Roulette" wheel. I wasn't brave enough to try it but you pay $11 (I think) spin for the chance to win a variety of drinks deals such as bottle of champagne, some drink + shot deals, or a glass boot filled with Moscow mule. I came here on a Tuesday and it was trivia night. It was a tough set of rounds but we definitely did fabulous in the picture round, city skylines!  

Minus two stars for unsafe environment: a patron repeatedly had her dog in various walkway locations and was never asked to move the dog- NOT EVEN after another patron tripped over the dog and fell flat on the ground. [Staff had walked passed and stepped over the dog multiple times prior to this incident so they definitely could have prevented this accident from happening!!] Come on, some people are already off balance enough when drinking without unexpected trip hazards in a dimly lit bar...
author: Shav S.

description:
I came here for two things....

Super Nintendo, and Drinks! 
Little did I know It was a tribute to all things old-school Like super nintendo, sega geneses, when I was dead broke man I couldn't picture this. Happy hour is incredible, the vibe is a dream come true it seems like a place Sheldon and crew from the big-bang theory would really enjoy, it allows has that "we are a new hidden bar made by frat kids and former college inventor drop outs" Yep, and that's the type of people you will find here! It's hard to find parking, in this area. But a place for Booze and good times, it is ONE OF THE BEST. Be-careful you might be tricked into spending money here
author: Michael R.

description: Another great stop when bar hopping in this area. This one is smaller than the nearby Wreck Room, but has great music and video games. There was a large screen on the back wall for Mario and a retro PacMan game to the side. Some people had made their own dance floor in the opening in the back as well. There was a decent amount of seating and a good atmosphere.
author: Susan G.

description:
I always have a fun time when I come to Soda Popinski's! Upbeat ambiance and fun vibe. There is a wheel you can spin if you pay $11. Whatever it lands on is the drink/drinks you're given. Sometimes you totally score and sometimes you think "I'd rather pass." Regardless, it's fun to spin the wheel.

There are also many TVs throughout the bar. I watched the Warriors win the NBA championship here and had a blast. The bar provided everyone with Warriors t-shirts and towels to wave around. Just goes to show how the staff wants to make sure you're having a good time.
author: Emmy Q.

description:
A night out with a huge group of friends and we found ourselves here. 

One thing to say, spin the wheel in the back! The drink is $11, cash only, of whatever you roll. From a bottle of champagne to PBR, the choices vary! I found part of the experience was spinning the wheel alone. 

Also, there are old school video games in the back, talk about taking me back to my childhood in the 90s! Talk about hip! 

The bar is quite dark, so if you like that, that's great. But I wish there was a tad more lighting.
author: Albert H.

description:
Drinks are cheap-ish.... less expensive than else where. I think it was $6 rum and coke and other basic mixed drinks. It gets up to 12 dollars or higher on the more complex mixed drinks.

It does get a little crowded since the bar is just basically a long room. There's a few tables and mostly everyone will need to stand.

However, bartenders are nice and knows how to mix their stuff for you.
author: Kay T.

description: I love the Greyhound here!  They use fresh grapefruit juice with lots of pulp.  Besides that, it's a nice spot that's set up like most bars in SF with a long and narrow walkway.  I've never been all the way to the back, but I think it opens up a bit so more people can hang out if you're in a bigger group.
author: Gloria N.

description: Whats not to love here? They have a wheel you can spin for $11 and you get whatever drink (or shots, or bottle of champagne) the wheel lands on! God help the person that gets the pickle shot (whiskey follow by a shot of pickle juice) or the cement mixer (Baileys mixed with lemon juice which curdles). They also have Nintendo in the back which was an awesome throwback to my childhood and which some of the broskis were enjoying.
author: Hayley H.

description: Nothing special, especially when you compare it to the many other bars in San Francisco. But there's a karaoke spot next door and the location (being right off polk) is convenient. I will add though, when I went I never spun the wheel and I know this adds to the attraction so take my review with a grain of salt.
author: Brittini S.

description:
Boot-sized Moscow Mules? Check.
Old school Nintendo Mario Kart games? Check.
$10 spin-the-wheel to win bottles of champagne or shots of fireball? Check.

I LOVE THIS PLACE!
author: Christine C.

description:
Super cute bar with a NES and a SNES in the back for you to play games on. We got there for happy hour and had a total of 4 beers for $12 because they're BOGO free. 

The spin the wheel game is fun to watch, but I would not want to drink anything on there... except maybe the bottle of champagne. The bartenders are nice and fun to talk to. The atmosphere is casual and fun. As a woman, this bar feels safe and neighborly. Not dark and predatory like some bars can feel. 

We'll be back for another happy hour soon!
author: Erin S.

description:
An interesting place, with interesting decor. There's a Drink Wheel where you pay $11 for a spin and you get whatever you get. You'll always get a drink, but sometimes it can suck (2 pickle backs) to something awesome (Mule Kick) to the BESTEST (a bottle of champagne). I came with a group of 5? 6? and we spun the wheel probably 10 times. Ended up with 3 Mule Kicks, several pickle backs, a double drink of the day, and a bottle of champagne. Cheers all around!

Small space, so it definitely gets crowded as the night goes on. There's a video game area in the back where you can sign up to play Mario Kart, etc. Fun stuff. It's fun watching buzzed/drunk people try to race each other in video games.
author: Judith C.

description: This was a decent bar. I didn't really experience the theme. And the crowed erred douchey. However, I will say that I got a seat even though it was packed, and that I was able to easily hold a conversation. And, for that I am grateful.
author: Andrew K.

description: Ay yo James made my stay at soda super chill. We all had lots of fun. Must go for SF.
author: Jaewon K.

description:
A nerd's heaven. This bar has a working super Nintendo and N64 in the back! What more can I saw? The sort of people who like watching super mario bros, Mario kart, the original smash bros, or Little Mac ROFL stomp Soda Popinski, will enjoy this bar. 

Overall, it's a great place to meet cool young people who have a slight gamer edge.
author: Jordan J.

description:
Came here yesterday night since it was close to my hotel. Got to spin the wheel three times hoping I'd land on the mule kick, which I did on the 3rd and last spin I was going to do! I got a hand grenade first spin, 4 shots of anything the bartender gives me on the 2nd spin, then finally the mule kick. 

Was pretty disappointed on all drinks to be honest--I'm a whiskey neat drinker and all drinks were made from Willy Wonka's factory, sweet as fk! Not gonna fault the bartenders for something they serve normally, it's just not my cup of tea. In the end, I fell back on my default Maker's Mark neat, and even that fell a little bit below my expectations because I think the bottle has been out for quite some time and the alcohol evaporated from the bottle, giving it an off flavor (or the sweet drinks messed with my taste buds). 

Honestly, I'm not gonna come back and can't really recommend the place to anyone who doesn't like sweet drinks, but it was interesting playing the super Nintendo and the bartenders were pretty nice.
author: Renny C.

description: This place was definitely gold. After 1 failed karaoke bar, we attempted to find a new place. We yelped "bars with good hip hop music" lol. We ended up ubering to go to Encore Karaoke. But then we hopped off our uber, we heard "Ignition" blasting from this bar and we HAD to come in. We ordered drinks. The music kept getting better and better so we just stayed the whole night. We spun the wheel twice. Got a bottle of champagne after winning a shot of firebomb and a free spin and a hand grenade! Needless to say, we had a pretty great night and woke up with a hangover that was well worth it. Lol.
author: Caroline N.

description: Never been to this bar, but I intend to come back again! Super fun! Especially the spinning the wheel! James is a great bartender, checking up on us from time to time.
author: Michelle S.

description: I came here on a Saturday night with some friends expecting to have a fun night. We had all heard of this place before and had high expectations. When we got in, it was 90 degrees inside which seems to be the trend with most bars in SF. There was barely any room to move but we squeezed our way to the back, where people were engrossed in a game of mario kart. They couldn't look away. There was also a wheel that cost $11 to spin, and there was an extremely long and slow-moving line for that. The music was super random and we felt very awkward trying to dance in the middle of the heated mario kart game. Is this considered fun? If so, it's not the right bar for me. I will not be back here.
author: Shilpa Y.

description:
-Pros-
2 for 1 specials on anything (pretty sure anything)
$10 Roulette Wheel for those adventure folks 
Old School Super Nintendo games 
Good amount of seating
Take cards

Overall Thoughts

A great local bar serving good drink deals with a lively atmosphere
author: Eddie W.

description:
Gambler? Alcoholic? 90s Lover? Nintendo Gamer? Russian?

Well.. I am all of the above and this is the place for me.  It is a, get this, 90's nintendo themed Russian bar.  Nothing but the hits like Biggie and Tupac plays and they have Punchout (the bar is named after a fighter from the game).

But the thing that should strike your intrigue is the roulette wheel behind the bar.  For $10, you can take a whirl.  You may end up with 4 shots, a bottle of champagne, a mule kick boot, etc.  Unless you get a tall can of PBR, everyone's a winner!  This is probably the best new bar in SF and if you go you have to play ROULETTE!

Also, just a quick stumble a few doors down is $2 pizza to cash in your roulette chips.
author: Joey S.

description:
Maybe it's because I'm currently hooked on the show "The Americans" but Soda Popinski's has so many other reasons that make it an awesome bar besides the heavy Russian theme in all its crimson glory. 

They have a great happy hour from 4-7 and 10-close I believe where it's buy one, get one free. The best part is that the bartender holds your second one till you're ready for it. Moscow Mules are one of their house cocktails and as it turns out, I love Moscow Mules! Nothing like the taste of ginger beer and lime to perk me up. In fact, I'm coming back next time to have a glass boot of it. That's right, they have boot steins of Moscow mules for $22. Fun times for everyone. 

Speaking of fun, Soda Popinski's has a random assortment of entertainment. There is old school Nintendo out back where folks showcase their best Mario skills. Feeling lucky, pay to spin the wheel (russian roulette I guess?) and see what drink prizes you get. 

I've heard it gets packed on weekend nights but we had a great time during early happy hour on a Monday and our bartender was incredibly sweet and on top of his game. I look forward to my return visit. Till next time comrade Soda Popinski's.
author: Jon L.

description: First time coming here and tried the wheel it was pretty cool,I met James Clark the bartender , really chill and friendly guy. I would recommend this place to my grandma and all her thotty friends.
author: Jose S.

description: 4 stars for their Trivia Night on Tuesdays. What's not to like about this? The drinks are decently priced, there is not entry fee, and you can win prizes (most involve getting money taken off your tab, but still awesome!). Teams are a max of 6/person and they have a bunch of different rounds. I love how there are tables/stools you can sit at. The trivia night is organized well, and although my team didn't win any prizes, we still had a great time. Parking can be tough in this area, but we were able to snag something close on a Tuesday night.
author: Amy D.

description:
A great place to grab drinks with friends. The atmosphere is laid back and everyone is always having a good time. 

If this is your first time here, you must spin the wheel! If this isn't your first time and you are with a first timer, make them spin the wheel. This always leads to a good night for us! 

If you are in the area and looking for a high energy water hole to blow off some steam, soda pop is the place for you!
author: Kristin F.

description:
Visiting from Seattle and staying in Nob Hill. Found this great bar looking for arcades or pinball. James was an amazing bartender with a relaxed attitude and inviting charm. Played some mike Tyson punch out and make sure and spin the wheel for the possibility of a free bottle of champagne for only $11! 

If I was local this would be my usual spot.
author: Kelsey B.

description: The place was interesting, I was kind of badgered by a really drunk guy, not sure if he was homeless, but I had to get up and leave. They have N64 in the back, kinda fun to play. The place wasn't as great as I thought it would be.
author: Brianna L.

description:
I went with a large group on a recent Tuesday night and ended up getting there just as they were starting their weekly bar trivia game. Fun, right? The questions were pretty easy and the time between questions and rounds was really long - they were either really trying to extend the game to keep people drinking, or the poor game master was overwhelmed trying to run it. We had fun playing along, though we weren't an official team. We stuck with beers, so I can't attest to the quality of their cocktails. They do have an interesting "Wheel of Misfortune," where you spin the wheel and you drink whatever you land on. Sounds like a neat idea if the mystery drink was cheap, but if I'm paying $11, then I'll pick my drink myself, thank you.

The theme here is Russian/Eastern Europe and the decor matches well. Service is decent and beer selection is ok.
author: Devin A.

description:
The Russian Roulette wheel is such a wonderful invention, I must give 5 stars. I spun the wheel and avoided the pbr, the vodka drunkenski, and landed right on the "4 shots of bartender choice". What nice surprise.

They were doing a fundraiser for an organization I am involved with, and it was awesome to feel that community feeling at a bar. I wish more bars did this.

The lay-out is bad, I will agree, but you just gotta push your way through. Sharpen your elbows.
author: Ari F.

description:
* The drink wheel and the Nintendo are definitely fun highlights of this bar. For most people, beating the wheel means winning a bottle of champagne. Some people are extremely good at getting this every single time, so it definitely seems like a skill that can be practiced to make perfect!

* This place is pretty popping Thursday-Saturday and is good for big groups. Be warned that it does get pretty noisy so you might want to avoid this place if that's not your thing. It's possible to find seating but don't count on it. 

* The crowd here is mostly young-mid twenties. Not super preppy but also not very hipster.

* Pro tip: Avoid trying to buy a drink on the side of the bar where the Wheel is if you don't plan to spin it since it is generally harder to get the bartender's attention. There is also a credit card minimum that (some of the) bartenders enforce so keep some cash if you only plan to have one drink.
author: Tasmin S.

description:
What's with SF and bars w/ too-narrow walkways?  It's impossible to get to the back of the bar, and once you get to the back, there's nothing interesting to do there.

The only "fun" that you might have here is the $10 for Russian Roulette that can score you anything from PBR to 3 back to back Fireball shots.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
This is one of those bars that you either overlook or you take the time to really appreciate the uniqueness of this gem. Man oh man is it easy to overlook. It's like one of those ugly broken down crustys on the outside, but inside is an atmosphere worth checking out.

So what's so good about this place? It can be summed up into two things. Old school games and what I like to call the Wheel of Death. You'll notice right when you walk in, the place is filled with the coolest old school games that just bring you straight back to your childhood. N64, Super Nintendo, Atari, etc. BOOM POKEMON BEEZY! Whatchu know about that?!

Oh yea and about the Wheel of Death. I just made that name up, but it's real. You spin the wheel for 11 bucks and whatever you land on, you get. It's def worth it though cus you can get pretty nice drinks/ expensive ones for a decent price. But honestly it's all about the fun. No complaining and you have to drink it. That is the rule. It's like if Zordon gave you an order and you denied his command. You think you would be a Power Ranger anymore after that? I don't think so. So you better suck it up and drink it down cus even MegaZord can't save you now.

Check it out. Worth it.
author: Nathan L.

description:
Sucker punch of booze.
2-for-1 happy hour. Oof.
Wheel of Misfortune.
author: Nish N.

description:
Came here on pride weekend so it was busier than expected. Yeah yeah, cool Nintendo in the back. Didn't play it though. Almost my entire drinking experience was off the "Russian Roulette" ($11+tips) - long story none of their mixed drinks taste good. You're better off with something straight out of the bottle like shots or beer. Tried cucumber cooler and moscow mule and neither of them were great. 

Spent quite a bit on the wheel so here's some insight on your drinks:
Bear Fight: Jagerbomb and Irish Car Bomb
Prairie Fire: Tobasco and Vodka (nasty)
Mule Kick: Moscow Mule in a boot
Double Drink of the Day: Double Moscow Mule

Bottom line - this bar knows how to mix vodka and ginger beers and that's about it.
author: Ryan L.

description: I've been to this bar a couple of times, coming back again soon. James is friendly and super chill, and makes great drinks.
author: Alvin K.

description:
So my only real complaint with this bar is that they watered down their liquor. Specifically, they watered down their shots of Jameson. This was the first bar we went to for the night, so our palates were relatively clean, but after taking our first shot of Jameson, the three of us immediately noticed how "smooth" the shot was. It was way too smooth to be normal Jameson. I don't have real high standards for bars, I only ask that drinks be reasonably priced (which they were), and that they serve a good drink (which they didn't). 

To be fair, I didn't try anything else, as we didn't want to stay after figuring this out, so maybe this was an isolated incident. However! If they employ this as a business practice, I'd recommend against going here. Sure they have an N64 which makes the place "different" and "fun", but when I go out, I do it to get my drink on, not play some stranger in mario kart. 

Other than that, the crowd is a mix of mid 20-30s, and the atmosphere seemed to be fun. If you're curious enough to go, it's not a terrible place to see, but I wont be back.
author: Andrew E.

description:
Really cool vibe, I mean com'on N64!?!?! 

The bar tenders knew their stuff and make great specialty drinks. 2 for 1 happy hour...
author: Greg F.

description:
In mother Russia, you don't head to the the bar... the bar goes straight to your head!  And wowzers were these drinks are STRONG LIKE YELTSIN and will make you go Yelpin' about them.  Our hero swung by for their (awesome) 10PM to 2AM 2-for-1 late night cocktail happy hour and was impressed by the taste and strength of their concoctions.  Nevermind that they also have an NES machine in the back because our hero's already sold on this place.

PROS:
- Cheap drinks and plenty of happy hour specials on school nights.
- Old school NES video games.
- Local crowd.

CONS:
- Russian Roulette wheel seems sort of pricey at $11 and doesn't have many good drinks on there.  It's best to just order what you want.
- The Soviet theme is a bit half-assed.
author: Albert W.

description: The vibe is cool here. They got old school gaming consoles.. NINTENDO!!! Saturdays are usually packed to the door... Try to come early or stand in the door way haha. As pack as it gets the bartenders usually still whip up ur drinks not like other bars where they would ignore u unless ur in their face. Wish there were seating areas tho with tables. Moscow mule on point!! oh ya. Spin that wheel!
author: Thomas N.

description:
GREAT SPORTS BAR!!!

Has great energy!  They definitely cater to the sports.  When SF teams do well they give our drink specials!!!  During WS they had $10 champagne bottles for 10 min after we got the WIN!

$4 PBR tall boys!!!  CHEEEEE!!!  But if you don't want to pretend like you are still in college they got the microbrews too.

They allow outside food, so bring take-out or order a pizza.  Everything plays!

Definitely one of the best spots to watch sports.  Gets crowded, so get there early and expect to be squished.  But if you want energy, this is the spot to be!
author: Steven F.

description: Came here for an alumni event raising money for charity using drink tips. Interesting place. It was tight, even though it wasn't super crowded and pretty hot in there. I think the premise is interesting, the old school video games were cool. the wheel of "misfortune" didn't make much sense to me. If I'm going to pay, I'm going to pay for the drink I want and not leave it to chance, but to each his own!
author: Gabrielle D.

description:
they have pickleback shots!!!!

all i need to know.  5 stars!
author: Casey P.

description:
SPIN
THE
WHEEL

Its a gimmick yes but so fun. I spun it and got 2 pickle backs which I couldn't complain about! My friend also spun the wheel and won a Mule Kick right after we did just order one at full price and finished it 0_0 Yeah be prepared when you spin the wheel!

They have great old school mario games but looks like you have to make sure to get in line to play. Also this place gets packed!!! So be prepared to have no personal space. It's worth it though! Fun times! :)
author: Christine W.

description:
There's Nintendo...a spin wheel for $10...Trivia in Tuesdays...happy hour is 2 for 1 drinks! 

Theme is a nice Soviet style that continues the famous Tonic Group signature of just unique enough to draw a crowd & attract your eye without being weird or overwhelming. 

Usually a pretty local crowd, gets packed on trivia nights. I like that Soda Popinski's is just off Polk St...so not as packed with crazies on the weekends as bars on the main drag, but still a great vibe!!!
author: Honey F.

description:
If anything, this place gets five stars for it's cool name and the fact that they have a giant drink wheel that you can spin wheel of fortune style! You can spin the wheel (for $11) and you get whatever drink you land on. I wasn't feeling very spontaneous so I opted out of the spin, but my friends did it and ended up with a 24 oz PBR and a Moscow Mule Kick in a boot shaped glass. It was very entertaining to say the least! 

I liked that the bar wasn't overly crowded, and we met some cool people. It was pretty chill and the bartenders were nice. You can also play some old school video games if your little heart desires! Cool spot, fun time! Check it out if you're in the area.
author: Maryclaire H.

description:
Was walking back to my hotel in Union Square and happened to walk past this spot. They were bumping awesome hip hop jams so I had to check it out. 

To my surprise it was all Russian themed. I'm Russian so that was a nice treat :)

They had some great drinks on the menu and I went with a blueberry vodka drink...I think it was called a Russian Turkey? Blueberries were muddled and fresh and the drink was sooo good. Bartender was really nice too. 

Bar was packed, music was good, decor was soviet themed and they had a Nintendo in the back with old school games.

Would def recommend to others and will be back when I come to SF next.
author: Lina K.

description: James , Tyson, and summer are the best! I had a great time! This bar is a lot of fun!
author: Vincent N.

description: I was here on Sunday so my experience will be different from somebody who went there during peak days. I felt like its a normal bar. Normal staff. Normal experience. Normal drinks. I cannot recall anything special about this place so I have no reason to go back. On the other side my experience was not bad, it was just pure normal :).
author: Veronika J.

description: Emily was super nice, she was super new to the city so we exchanged stories and places to go. Loved the retro Nes, SNES stuff
author: Ray K.

description: We held a charity event here this week. We were surprised that they allowed us to use their venue but in the end very pleased with their professionalism and services. The bar looks small in pictures but its a decent size and the happy hour is fun. The drinks were  good although the beers were not as good as other bars. They have a gaming console in the back for all of you gamers n techies. Very short commute from downtown. To get their by foot you'll be hike up one of the steepest hills in the city so Uber it or take the trolley. It'll be worth it.
author: Jermaine J.

description:
Thanks to Yelp, I ended up here. I looked up the rating of the in-hotel bar; one of the reviews expressed frustration that anyone would bother with it when there were dozens of better spots within waking distance.  

My following search led me here.   It's smallish (packed to capacity it might handle about 50) but has definitely opted for quality over quantity.  While the fresh-squeezed grapefruit juice for the greyhounds brought me in, I actually evaluated the drinks based on the house old fashioned, which was strong and traditional -- and then came garnished with a stick of rock candy to mellow the alcohol as you see fit.   Later, the salty dogs proved superior in a town where I drank many of them, and the 1-liter mule was darn fine.

The Soviet and Nintendo theme is directly aimed at those of a particular generation, but the appeal seems quite broad beyond that.  Even during midweek doldrums the crowd was enjoying the place as much as me; the Nintendo was consistently seeing action and the $10 cocktail wheel would get hit several times an hour and always by those willing to play by the rules.  Even when that meant a cement mixer.  

If I lived in the area, I'd be a regular.  

If you're staying at the Golden Gateway and looking for nearby fun, look no further.
author: Josh M.

description: Spun the great wheel and didn't realize there were $3 beers on there.  My fault,  but $11 for a beer is bad.  Nevertheless,  one bartender for 50+ people doesn't make sense. Bad bar.
author: Michael R.

description:
They have an old school nintendo in the back which made me feel a lil nostalgic.  I wasn't really into the bear skin on the wall...

I think the wheel of drinks is kind of ingenious.  I can't tell you how many people I witnessed willing to spend $11 without a clue as to what they might be drinking (ie. tall PBR, bottle of champagne, fireball, or prairie fire... whatever the hell that is).  As for me, I'd much rather pay $7 and know exactly what I'm getting (at least when it comes to booze!), but hey--whatever floats your boat!
author: Olivia D.

description: Awesome bar! We did a fund raiser here, so they let our girls do bar tending (after quick mix / cash register training) and all the tips went toward the fundraiser. Great vibe, excellent greyhound with fresh squeezed grapefruit. Good vibes, great location, hope to return.
author: Brian J.

description:
They have a drink wheel like the other reviews mention - $10 upfront gets you one spin.  Drinks range from a bottle of champagne to a firebomb(?) which is cinnamonny and strong to 4 shots of the bartenders' choice or even a russian iced tea (like a long island w/ cranberry -- ask for it sweeter if you like).  Drinks which average $10 each unless you want a "boot" for $22 are also a bit different and more fusion with such infusions to their margaritas as jalapeno but not over-the-top fancy.

The walkway is narrow and the place can get crowded.

There's a few TVs and a nintendo which can be fun.

It's casual and dim with a personable crowd that's super chill.  For this little bar, I'm pleasantly satisfied.
author: Jennifer Y.

description:
Absolutely great staff. Kind, generous, and all-around awesome.

*The NES and N64 in the back is sweet. 
*Men's room has waterless urinals - brilliant.
*Drinks are good and strong.
*Peroni in a bottle
*Drink wheel is fun to watch.
*Crowd is good.

Overall, I'm coming back.
author: Tory F.

description:
*What's special about this place is it has a spin the wheel of drinks. Very quirky. And the Mule Kick in a boot. And the back has old Nintendo hooked up to play old games. How nostalgic.

ATMOSPHERE:
Small nice contemporary basic divey layout. Near Polk and California where buncha other bars are avail to do a crawl and have a very inebriating night.
author: Angela L.

description: Went on a Friday night. Really good crowd, with laid back people and good drinks. I didn't play the Wheel of misfortune (as I later learned it is called) but I definitely will next time I come. The decor is soviet themed, which I found to be unique and refreshing. Will try to play nintendo and wheel of misfortune next time I make it there.
author: Vassiliki K.

description:
This place is pretty interesting. It's definitely a fun spot to grab a drink. They do polar bear fights / bear fights (if you don't know what that is, go there and get one..but be prepared for a crazy night). They also have a drink wheel where you pay I think it was $10 to spin. You can get anything from a bottle of champagne to some nasty cheap drinks.

Oh yea, they have a huge screen in the back where you can play video games.
author: Ryan L.

description:
they place was super unexpected. I didn't think that I'd find a random bar on this block that was super busy on a random weekday. The bartenders were friendly and randomly enough they have fireball and two other hard alcohols on tap.
They kick it old school in this place with an N64 on a huge screen with people drinking and challenging eachother to mario kart. CLASSIC!!!
They also have this spin wheel where you pay to spin it and could either come out with a total bust or win some randomness of a drink.
author: Cescilia A.

description:
This bar has been a bunch of different things over the past few years. I love the current incarnation.

Video game consoles in the back, awesome bar up front--quiz nights, fun people but not too marina-y or hipster-ific, it's a great addition to the area.
author: Paul C.

description: While visiting SF my girlfriend and friend decided to do some day drinking in the Polk street area. pretty interesting bar. got in a game of Mario kart on the TV in the back which was pretty cool. hit it up if you're in the area!
author: Michael M.

description: A fun and totally unexpected bar in Pac Heights.  Don't let the gimmick wheel scare you off.  Good selection of beers and spirits.  Responsive, friendly bar staff.
author: Rich P.

description:
I'll bet you a drink the Nintendo and the wheel drove all the 5-star reviews.

On more than one occasion, I've found the old fashioned to be unbalanced and far too strong to enjoy. The dunham cooler is refreshing, but nothing special. For $10 a pop, I've not been impressed with the drinks - the lack of finesse in making them nor the final result.

The good news is that everyone seems to fit in here - from hoodied dudes that just want to play NES, dressed-nicer-than-you'd-expect couples, neighborhood folk, and on my last rendezvous, two or three couples necking in the back. It works. It's cozy. It's casual. It's completely unpretentious.

Best bet, grab a pint and head for the back. 
There's something for everyone.
author: Alissa A.

description: Great place (when it's not crowded) to watch a game and/or get together with a group. For the first hour we were there, it was BOGO drinks so we got a round of 6 Bulleit shots for about $25. Great deal! Even after the special was over, drinks were moderately priced. Bonus points for allowing dogs, outside food and having a drink spinning wheel ($11 and you get to spend the wheel, getting wherever drink/ drink special you land on). Very walkable along Post St.
author: Ashley Nicole C.

description: The wheel of fortune is cool, the throwback nintendo is a nice touch.  It's dark and damp feeling inside (lots of beer has been spilled I'm guessing).  My phone was stolen here two months ago and I confronted the guy who I'm pretty sure did it.  Be careful with your valuables and don't let them out of your sight, for a second.  I hear theft is common in that area.
author: Clarissa P.

description:
Are you looking for a relaxed non-hipster bar? Then this is the place for you! 

A friend and I were wandering around trying to find a place to grab some tasty drinks and after some Yelping around, we stumbled upon this lovely gem. It was packed when we got in but once we had some drinks in our hands, we were definitely not disappointed. Thank you Yelpers for recommending the Moscow Mule because it's AMAZING. Really really amazing. Like, you'll definitely order more than one amazing. Don't leave without getting one! 

The atmosphere is very relaxed, everyone around you is just there to have a good time, and the bar plays really great music. It's a little on the loud side but then again, what bar isn't? We didn't get to see the famed Nintendo Mario Kart, but we did see people going for the $10 spin the wheel. How great is that?? This place doesn't disappoint!
author: Frances L.

description:
My inner child got hammered this weekend at Soda Popinski's.

A bar with strong drinks, a fun atmosphere, and 8-bit Nintendo games? Hell yes! Being just off Polk Gulch meant that Soda's was packed on Friday night, making their already thin bar area tough to traverse, but like most bars with awesome features, it attracted some great people and made the evening all sorts of fun. You'll have to go early if you want much room or a lot of time to play, but given the draw of the place, you'll enjoy yourself while you're waiting.

This is now my first favorite spot on Polk south of Playland. Give it a shot, it might become yours too!
author: Kevin B.

description:
Mike Tyson's Punch Out!!!  Are you old enough to get the name of the bar -  Soda Popinski???

Wooden interior and solid selection on the walls. Beer and a shot specials on Monday night. Any liquor....not just Jack. Loving that! Dan the bartender was chill and down for a chat about 80's songs and video games.

On the smaller side but still adding to my rotation of Polk St bars to booze at.
author: Jay H.

description:
Went here on a slow, Sunday afternoon and felt like I left a happy hour.

The bartender was really sweet and she let me spin this fun prize wheel and I won two shots of my choice-yay!

Bonus points- in the back there are nintendo games you can play for free and they even have Mike Tyson's Punch Out where you can try to fight Soda Popiski's character- cool!
author: C M.

description:
Nothing special about this place a great bar to start or end your night you choose. I do wish there were more bars like this in Los Angeles. When I walked in with my group of friends, there was excitement by one of the bartenders because we were from Los Angeles. It seemed like many there were regulars and we kinda felt isolated but nevertheless it was okay place to start our night! 

I spun the wheel twice and got 2 shots of fireball and their special drink to which to this date I don't know what it was!
author: erick P.

description:
Really diggin' this new bar in town, although their Russian roulette wheel is weighted, I swear.

For $10, you get to spin the wheel.  There are prizes ranging from their $22 Mule Kick cocktail-in-a-boot down to PBR and the dreaded cement mixer.

So far I've spun 3 times.  Twice I've gotten a $10 PBR, and once I won the consolation prize--2 draft beers.  Not once have I spun for the bottle of champagne or four shots!

There's a Nintendo in the back with All Punch Out all The Time.  Too bad Soda Popinksi is so many levels into the game.  By the time you drink a Mule Kick, you're bound to lose due to beer muscles.

I had a different bar tender the last two times, and both were really nice people.  I've never been on a shit-show-Friday night though.
author: Rocco B.

description:
Went here over the weekend and unfortunately it was not m cup of tea...

Over crowded, literally people next to you and right in your space. Plus acme the venue isn't as spacious it made it difficult to move or walk over to the bar. Just going to the bathroom was a mere challenge.

Drinks were okay, nothing special.

I won't be coming here anytime soon.... On to the next one :)
author: Mae M.

description:
OODLES of fun! I found myself incredibly intrigued as I heard old school 90s hip hop as I passed by on the way to Wreck Room and HAD to stop by.

Besides music that really resonates with me, I was also a fan of the cute bartenders who were dancing along with the beats while whippin' up a delicious drink. There was something Mario-related happenin' in the back but I was already having a good time by the bar and found no need to venture. Will be back with a crew for sure.
author: Furai X.

description: The 2-for-1 happy hours are awesome (especially the late night hh!), the staff is friendly and pour with a heavy-hand, and the wheel is always a great time!  Love love love.
author: Morgan C.

description:
I LOVE this place! I'm not even sure why I love this place- but I LOVE this place!

Came here Friday night with two friends. One friend had mentioned she'd been wanting to go for awhile, and I'm glad we did! Soda Popinski's has a great vibe. It's dark, it's sexy, it's divey without being creepy, it's classy without being pretentious. The crowd seemed kinda awesome, and the bartenders rocked my socks.

Soda Popinski is awesome because:

1) Nintendo in the back to play?!?! UMM YES!
2) Roulette wheel of drinks?!?!? UMM YES! (I'm not that brave of a soul, but I very much enjoyed watching a friend of mine land on some horrid things.)
3) Song requests? That actually get played?!?!? You seriously made my night! ("I would walk 500 miles, and I would walk 500 more...")

Honestly can't wait to go back!
author: Annalise F.

description:
This place has a classic Nintendo in the back and greyhounds made with freeze squeezed (to order) ruby red grapefruits.

By far my favorite drink in the city!

The also have a wheel that you soon for different drinks.  Spin 1 sucked (a fireball shot), but spin 2 was better .... got a bottle of champagne!  This place is definitely one of my favorite bars in the city.
author: Kenyon S.

description: ugh. i've just never been a fan of this place. i can understand and appreciate why people like it, but just blehhh. drinks are average, decor is average, people watching and bartenders are average.. ughhh.
author: Christina L.

description:
