My friends and I checked out this new bar last week.  I was blown away!!  The prices are great, the staff is awesome, the location is perfect, and the atmosphere is friendly and fun.  None of us had a problem getting a cab at the end of the night.  It is an ideal addition to SF and a must visit!

(I was not given any discount or any other type of compensation for this posting.)
author: Todd F.

description: Concept of the place looked cool. Drinks also looked good on yelp, so I decided to go here with a few friends. Place was super crowded when I got there. Some of the decor looks like they bought it from Bigfoot a few blocks away. I got the Dickle in a Pickle. since I usually like pickle flavored drinks. I was disappointed in my drink, because it turned out to be a pickleback shot, not a cocktail! That should be written clearly. My friend got the Old Fashion, which had too much ice in it. I wasn't able to check out the games in back, since the place was too crowded, I couldn't go check it out. If I do come back, maybe I'll come during off peak hours and only get beer.
author: Lisa T.

description:
This is a cute little bar near my place that used to be the Gold Star Bar. Drinks were affordable, bartenders were friendly, and there's a major 80s vibe going, between the music and the classic Nintendo set up on a big screen tv for patrons to drunkenly run Mario around.

The weird Marina guy who followed us home can stay there though. That was just too weird.
author: Cassandra J.

description: Wanted to grab a drink after work on a Tuesday night and ended up going to Soda Popinski's. Well, one drink turned into three and multiple rounds of Nintendo favorites. What a great place!! We had such an unexpectedly great time. The cocktails are fantastic, and pretty strong. My favorite was the blackberry vodka cocktail, closely followed by the cucumber cooler. All of the ingredients are fresh, and the bartenders are really friendly and attentive. The Nintendo and decor are major highlights of this bar, and since it was fairly empty, we had the entire back area and Nintendo to ourselves. Oh, and two for one drinks during happy hour? Don't mind if I do! Will definitely be coming back here often for happy hour drinks with my friends.
author: Regina L.

description: This place is straight up balls to the walls lit!!!  When you go, it's IMPERATIVE YOU ORDER THE "JAMES BRANDY".   This drink can only be served by a bartender named "James".  You have to ask for him specifically and ask for this drink.  This drink is everything...it's on the secret menu..if you can't get it, it's probably because you're not cool enough.
author: Mike W.

description:
Went here for SantaCon. The place was completely packed, but I loved that the bar tenders were super chill and friendly despite the chaos. Drink prices seemed reasonable. I think it was $8 or 9 for a drink/shot of Jack Daniels. 

Only downside was the bathroom situation. There were only two single person bathrooms (one male, one female), so you basically have to go get in the bathroom line when you "think" you may need to use the bathroom soon. 

They played great music that day too, a mix of top 40, hip hop, R&B, and 90s jams.
author: T S.

description:
With only 13 reviews on Yelp, we were surprised to show up to a super packed bar. At 12:30am it was shoulder to shoulder throughout the bar.

My Greyhound was tasty, but specialty cocktails are expensive at $10 a pop.

They have video games on the back wall and for $10 you can play drink roulette (you win anything from cans of PBR to a bottle of champagne or $22 specialty drink). 

I'd like to see how it is earlier on in the night before the crowd gets there.
author: Annaliese D.

description: Nice setting. Close to Polk. Friendly people.
author: Shawn O.

description: There is a roulette wheel you can spin. They seem deadly though. There are even games you can pull out to play with friends. A definite place to bring friends to hang out. It was a bit loud so I was sort of confused with how people can play board games. Their drink was strong and tasty.
author: Christina L.

description:
Soda Popinski let me and four friends guest bartend on Saturday night and donated all of the tips from a three hour time period to charity.  First of all, it is completely awesome and amazing that they let you fundraise by bartending, even if you have no previous bartending experience (like me). This bar is owned by the same people who own Tonic where they also allow guest bartending (they also own Bullitt and Dr. Teeth) and I am extremely grateful to the owners who allowed us to raise money this way - it is extremely generous.  It is much more fun to get all of your friends to come drink at a bar than ask them for donations outright! 

Second, this bar is awesome.  They play great music, they have an old school nintendo set with a ton of games, there are multiple TVs, they have excellent drinks, and they have a wheel you can spin for some great (and some not so great) prizes. 

Third, they have the best bartender I have ever met whose name is Dan.  Dan works on Saturday early evenings. You should all go to the bar while Dan is there and tip him very well. Dan was the real bartender who was working that night and he was nice, patient and made the whole experience really really fun even though he was juggling a bar full of patrons and five newbie bartenders! So thanks Dan and thanks Soda Popinski!
author: Sarah G.

description: Went there for Halloween. Ordered 1 beer, and this waiter guy charged me $29.50, which I didn't even notice in the beginning... When I did, I immediately went back to him, and very politely told him I thought he had made a mistake, and asked him to fix it. He said I had ordered all these other drinks before that one beer, through the night, and I replied that was not possible, because I had only been there for 5 minutes. He insisted, so I asked him to check if he had in fact registered my credit card earlier that night. He "checked" and said YES, so he just LIED about it. At that point, I told him I believed he was making an honest mistake, but that I would appreciate it if he could check again, because that was REALLY not possible. And so he "checked" again, and brought me a new check for $4.50, without saying one word, or even looking at me. Needless to say, he did NOT apologize. I still tipped his snotty ass, but I'm NOT going back to this place.
author: Marc A.

description: This spot was amazing, I was surprised and impressed with the amazing amount service and attention I received from James the bartender. The drink prices are reasonable and the spin wheel is fun and a great deal.  I'll definitely visit again.
author: Jennifer J.

description:
This is such a great bar that I would love to see make it in this location! Other bars have gone out of business previous to this one. 

Fun and casual vibe with stiff drinks, friendly bartender, old school Nintendo and an awesome drink roulette wheel that you can spin for $10! We won a bottle of champagne! Will be back for sure!
author: Chauanh D.

description: Great bartenders, great crowd. The bartender didn't judge me when I asked him to pour me half shots.
author: Khanh T.

description:
There's something for everyone here. Trivia, video games, cracking weekends, and a wheel of destiny for drinks.
They've spent a lot of effort curating a fine staff.
Barney, Brennan, Erica, Melissa, James, Garrett, Heather,... Top notch folks. Honestly, you're hard pressed to find such great bartenders elsewhere. Big props to the men working the door -- Dennis and Larry give a good impression of the bar from outside.
I've been coming here for a few years. Highly suggested that new people to the area give it a shot.
Honorable mention is "good playlists".
author: Peter N.

description: Lovely ambiance! Try the flat-liner, it's to die for! The fresh greyhound and raspberry basil gimlet are also delicious!
author: Meriann S.

description: Laid back neighborhood spot, great if you just want to grab a drink with friends.  Don't get the bloody mary drink. It's terrible. Other drinks are okay.
author: Grace C.

description: I still stand by my review, the crowd is unpretentious, the HH drink special (everything 2 for 1) is an unbeatable deal. But what really stands out is the excellent service. Every bartender I've encountered here either truly enjoys being there or does a damn well job of faking it. I've never come across such consistently friendly/happy bartender ever.
author: Amanda F.

description: What is this place?! Fresh squeezed juice mixers? A functional and clean bathroom in a bat? Free classic video games? Awesome friendly staff? This place kicks much ass!!
author: Alan T.

description: Great reasonably priced fun bar in the middle of polk street.  Wheel of Misfortune is always a fun way to have fun with a group of friends.
author: Daniel Y.

description:
This is a little late, but totally necessary!

I went to Soda Popinski's on July 4th for a usual game of Smash Brothers with some friends. Once again, it was a great time! Fair prices for drinks and a cool, relaxed crowd makes this place a gem around Polk. Busy enough to meet new people every time, yet small enough to occasionally run into some familiar faces :) This particular night I left a jacket on one of the couches in the back. Inside was my new phone and because of work, I feared that I would need to buy a new one right away. However, the phone was still on the following day which lightened by hopes that maybe someone had turned it in. I made the trip back the next day and was able to sit and have a beer with the bartender named James. He was so cute and friendly that I stayed for another. He helped me by going out of his way to look for the jacket/phone and with much luck, found it! I was so happy to have not only a great night on the 4th, but also a lucky 5th by meeting James and finding my phone! :) 

Will be back!!
author: Mary Claire M.

description: I was a big fan of the last place (Gold ..something something) before the owner sold and they renamed.  Its a good cheap spot near my crib that has some seriously knowledgeable bar staff.  The only downside is that this has become another spot on the weekend "Marina crawl" that invades Polk street when those kids come a slummin.
author: Dru P.

description: Kinda bummed that they took away trivia night but i still love the bar.  Great service and cool atmosphere, let's hope the marina douchiness doesn't ruin it!
author: Tina N.

description: New favorite neighborhood bar scene. Cheap drinks, drink wheel and nintendo with all the classics - Mario Bros, Kung Fu, Mike Tyson's Punch Out.
author: John L.

description: This place is a joke. The bartenders are thieves, especially the bald guy. They double tabbed me and my gf, and wouldnt give us the prize when we won in the roulette. This place sucks.
author: Jennifer A.

description: Love this place!  All the NES games that you loved as a child are here waiting for you to play them!  If there's a wait to play go spin the wheel and get a mystery drink!  Hopefully you land on the bottle of champagne.
author: Durty D.

description: Spin the wheel! These guys are great - and the 2-1 happy hour is clutch. TNG sponsors my rugby team and this is one of our favorite spots for any night of the week
author: Braunson C.

description: Definitely a spot to check out.  Very chill atmosphere.  Bartender was super cool and very nice, had great drink suggestions.  Two things to do are : spin the wheel and play some NES or N64.  Worth it!
author: Brian R.

description: If you live in San Francisco and even halfway enjoy the 20-30 year old crowd, slightly divey scene and standing shoulder to shoulder at the bar, you will find plenty to love at Soda Popinski. There is a definite Bullitt vibe to the place (same owners), and you can expect a similar crowd and atmosphere. There is slightly more space to maneuver here, however. The back wall has a large TV screen playing classic Nintendo games controlled by the patrons, which may not sound like a draw until you are actually there and you find yourself glued to the screen cringing every time Mario shrinks from inadvertent contact with a cannon shot... The other awesome part of this bar is the drink wheel. You can pay ten dollars to spin the wheel and you are awarded with whatever drink you land on. Sometimes you end up with a measly can of beer, other times you might get the coveted (depending on who you are) Mule Kick... which brings me to the Mule Kick. Don't drink this by yourself. I'm not saying this to caution you from getting too drunk. It's certainly drinkable and won't cause you to fall asleep curled up on the floor. The true effects are felt the next morning. There are several Moscow Mules dumped into one large cup/bowl, and the pure amount of sugar was not properly accounted for until I felt like there was a small alien trying to through my stomach and head in the morning. They serve it with multiple straws for a reason (no, not so you can drink it faster)... One of the more fun bars I've been to in the city, and I've covered some ground the past couple years. Enjoy
author: Taylor C.

description: Man listen...if you like nostalgic Nintendo games, you need to come here. Spacious bar with various assorted drinks & did I forget nostalgic Nintendo games! Come have a drink & play Mike Tyson Punch Out. You will not regret it.
author: Sean H.

description: Sweet new bar in the area. They have a 2 for 1 happy hour which is always a nice perk.
author: Dilly M.

description: Cool spot in the city, bartenders aren't bad, the music was actually bearable at least something to groove to, plus they an old school Nintendo hooked up in the back. Yelpers if you're in the area check it out, very nice atmosphere
author: Lee R.

description: The beer here is good, but the atmosphere was definitely not for me. There were drinks all over the seats, the floor was sticky, and the service was slow. My guy friends were enjoying themselves more, I guess. I think any bar that has a tv with a nintendo is a place I should stay away from. Not my scene at all, but I can understand how a different crowd would enjoy it.
author: Sheeva G.

description: Another SF Dive Bar with a dark Soviet/Russian Theme to it which was a bit strange but hey, SF IS STRANGE.  Good crowd here and actually really good music every time i'm here.  Im really not sure why but maybe the DJ's were in college around the time I was bc the music on weekend is current pop/hip hop mixed with stuff from the 2000-2005 time.  Also can we please get a slow clap for the old school Nintendo.  I had some friends in from out of town that came here and we played some Mike Tysons Punch out and Contra before bouncing out to another bar...only to RETURN to Soda's at 1AM.  Good times
author: David D.

description: This is a really neat bar, with a lot of cool shit in it. The bartenders are great, and the trivia is a lot of fun. The drinks are fair to low priced, and there's definitely a good time around. I look forward to going back on Tuesday's for trivia!!
author: Clinton J.

description: Stopped by while staying in Nob Hill this week. Great ambiance and decoration. The wheel is fun to spin but beware of some funky drinks. Great convo with the bartender. The Nintendo in the back was a definite plus. All in all a great spot to have a drink and relax. Def would visit again next time I'm in town.
author: Eric M.

description: Great dive bar.  2 for 1 drinks from 5-7.  Super Mario in the back.  Pretty much all you could need, well except for food.  So order in a pizza while you double fist your drinks, and you'll be in good shape.
author: Brooke S.

description: 2 for 1, everyday! I love Soda Popinski's, bartenders are friendly and pay attention. They have videos games in the back from the original nintendo which I think is awesome and at times it's fun to watch and see peoples strategies. I have given it a go a couple times, but prefer to observe, ha! They also have a drink wheel which is $10 bucks and what every you spin you win, prizes range from shots, bottles of champagne, beer in boots and more! The other cool thing about this bar is from what I have seen they love to reach out and have their consumers do fundraising and raffels, all of which are for a good cause and makes a difference. I like a bar that likes their community and cares for other people who care. 2 for 1!
author: Manuel H.

description: Great drinks, fun place, a lot of seating! Amazing happy hour, friendly bartenders and they do a lot of charity events, which I appreciate!
author: Amber M.

description: My first visit to Soda Poppinski's and this place is pretty dope! James the bartender was very friendly and inviting, and he definitely made us want to come back soon. Playing Mario Kart on the bar's Nintendo 64 gaming system brought back so many memories and was so fun, despite being intoxicated I manged to win 3 games in a row! For anyone who comes here, I definitely recommend spinning the "wheel" to determine your first drink. Awesome spot!
author: Nick H.

description: Killer HH!!  Bartender is delightful!  Great atmosphere for drinking. Music choices are ideal for any taste. Drinks are strong and poured with love. Spin the wheel if you are feeling frisky...
author: Kaili H.

description: Came here last Tuesday for Trivia Night, and had a great time.  The bartender, Cory, was super nice and attentive to our whole group, and the host for trivia that Night, Matt, was equally awesome and hilarious.  Vibe was pretty laid back, but it was really picking up when I was on my way out.  We were sitting in the back area, where they have an original Nintendo set up on a huge TV, and apparently if you beat Mike Tyson in 'Punch-Out' you get a free bottle of champagne?  Rad.  Coming back for sure.
author: Kyle O.

description: If this place believed in a capacity limit, it would probably be a good time.  However, I don't find being packed like a sardine a good time :(
author: Saeed E.

description: Soda Pop rocks... solid drinks, cool 8 bit nintendo meets stalinesque russian motif. Gets wild on the weekend and is a bit more low-key during the week. You can hang at the bar and get to hang with the neighborhood locals.
author: Daniel B.

description:
I've only ever been here during happy hours and I am definitely a fan of 2 for 1!! And a bar that takes credit cards is always a bonus!

Why doesn't it get 5 stars? Well, I think it's because the rotation of bartenders can mean that some nights you get an awesome one (makes the drinks well, holds the 2nd free one until you've had your first, doesn't roll eyes at said credit card) and other nights...well, not so much. 

But you can still find me here most evenings - pre-gaming with some of the tastiest dranks on Polk!
author: S. P.

description: I was sad to see Gold Star go, but I'm ecstatic to have Soda Popinski in the hood.  Everyone who works here is a delight, there's a great selection of drinks and the space has a clean open feel.  Big TVs for any game and plenty of places to eat nearby.
author: Corey V.

description: Awesome place, looooove the wheel & the non-profit fundraiser night!
author: Y S.

description:
Awesome bar with really awesome bartenders and drinks. Cool decor and good music. Check out the drink list for some unique ones. As mentioned in many other reviews, they have NES with a bunch of games on a plasma screen. Spin the wheel if you dare...

Shout out to Dan for helping and guiding me and the group out during our stint as guest bartenders for charity. Genuinely great guy!
author: yoni s.

description: Tetris and reasonably priced drinks? Yes, please! Really fun vibe, inexpensive and the owner is great. I arrived REALLY early to watch World Series game and he let me come in early to get out of the rain and wait for my friends. Next time I'm in SF I will definitely return.
author: Kristina G.

description:
White Shark on tap.
Gr8 tenders 'n patrons.
No craziness.
author: Pablitomichel R.

description:
Soda Popinski is AMAZING!

Great location, drinks made to perfection by awesome friendly bartenders. They hosted our Movember fundraiser for us and were so helpful and supportive. Definitely my new favorite place to grab a bourbon.
author: Sean S.

description: on the way to wreck room to watch the giants i stumbled upon this nice little joint. one thing i loved....new bar smell!!!!! why did i stop here instead? the energy flowing from this new watering hole was so inviting. nothing is better than drinking with a bunch of giants fans on a nice day! the interior is reminiscent of of madrone in some ways. dark wood, dead animals just chilling. lots of tvs great seating options and a nicely fully stocked bar. the bartender was also super nice. $6 for a rum and coke...not to shabby for this area. glad i stopped on in.
author: Ashley H.

description: One of those great moments when you discover a bar that is off the beaten track but is not actually off the beaten track. In fact I have walked past it every time I go up and down Polk but its unassuming entrance betrays the magical drinks inside. It also has a 'Cheers' like quality where great people prop themselves up at the bar. It is one of those wonderfully unpretentious bars that lets you get food locally and eat it at their bar. One tip - order an old fashioned from the owner Corey.
author: Tom C.

description: Great little bar with excellent service. Free Nintendo!
author: Tom D.

description: Great atmosphere, great drinks!  Soda Popinski is worth a visit.
author: Brandy C.

description: What a cool little bar!  Great vibe.   Its on a side street off of Polk, so its definitely a destination spot - you have to have this place in mind as you venture off Polk and down California.  We stopped by on a Saturday night, and it pleasantly was busy and bustling.  In the back there is a flat screen hooked up to a Nintendo.  For you youths out there, a Nintendo was an ancient predecessor to the XBOX - think of it like an ancient predecessor to the Wii.  After watching for a bit, it was easy to ascertain the Nintendo game of choice for this place is Punch Out.   I learned from another person there that the name of the bar itself, was in honor of one of the boxing characters in that game.   Learn something new every day.  But of course I had to go home and verify that on wikipedia: http://bit.ly/dLMShA   What an awesome angle to give people a venue to  a) drink  and  b) play Nintendo at the same time.  How many places can you do that?  We only stayed for one drink - but the bartender poured it strong.  Wish we had more places like this out in the East Bay.  Maybe I'll just have to move to SF :-)  5 stars.
author: Jaydee B.

description: I had great time here for a meet up first a few hours I was there. But I found that I lost my wallet a few hours later since I left the bar. I gave them a call, but no one answered. I lost my hope but still went back to bar to see if they found it. The bartender gave me back the wallet almost as soon as I told him I lost my wallet. I was so happy and thankful. ( this happened tonight. lol. Thank you so much...!)
author: Bonna C.
